results.title: Changing worlds: my journey
results.brief_description:
Mui Mui’s family fled China to Saigon and with the fall of Saigon they experience persecution and are again forced to flee. The journey from Vietnam to Australia is rough and dangerous with time spent in appalling conditions in a camp in Malaysia. Mui Mui reflects on how she and her family worked hard to adapt to a new country and create a new life.
Made at ACMI as part of the ‘Recovering Hope’ Digital Storytelling project, in partnership with VicHealth and Belgium Street Neighbourhood House.

results.title: Dressing a Chicken
results.creator_credit: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description:
Please be advised, this film features footage of dead animals.

Produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture, this short instructional film demonstrates the correct method for cleaning and dressing poultry. The film is an interesting historical insight into the changing nature of food production and distribution. It would once have been normal for people to handle a fresh chicken carcass rather than a pre-prepared one from the butcher, and the size of the chicken is considerably smaller than today’s standards.

results.title: Game Masters: in conversation with Warren Spector
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, ACMI Content Development and ACMI Public Programs
results.brief_description:
Join Warren Spector, master of role playing game design, as he explores the ideas that have changed the gaming industry.
Spector is known for creating influential titles such as ‘System Shock’, ‘Deus Ex’, ‘Ultima Underworld’ and ‘Thief: The Dark Project’. His most recent release, ‘Disney Epic Mickey’, has been hailed as the embodiment of his renowned philosophy on videogame design.
This interview is a rare opportunity to hear from an industry legend, who has irrefutably influenced videogame theory and design. Filmed as part of the ACMI ‘Game Masters’ exhibtion 2012.

results.title: Going Our Way
results.creator_credit: Chris Gallagher, Victorian Railways and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: Presents the many employment opportunities in the Victorian Railways. A young boy playing with his toys, including a train, dreams of his future. He becomes a station assistant. Shows how he learns his job and benefits from the V.R.I. library and sporting clubs. Includes executive officers who started at the bottom and worked their way to the top.

results.title: Simmo, the man I love
results.brief_description: John’s reputation as a great pilot earned him the respect of his colleagues, especially one admirer, Yolanta. But towards the end of his career, it felt like he was losing his touch, something was wrong. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.

results.title: Ron's story
results.brief_description: A wife remembers her wonderful life with her husband, who can now no longer remember it with her. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: La partria o la tumba
results.brief_description: Socialist parents, rebellious children - it runs in the blood. Esteban’s parents originally came from Uruguay but were forced to flee to Australia in 1974 from the ruling military regime. His father, aged 32, and mother, aged 21, eventually settled in Melbourne raising four children and establishing the first South American bakery, in Yarraville. In this story, Esteban talks of his family’s experiences and his deep respect for his wonderful rebellious parents.

results.title: Dandenong
results.brief_description: A walk down memory lane in this black and white 1950s footage of the Dandenong Trades Exhibition which includes shots of white goods, furniture and TVs, Holden cars, streetscape images and a fashion parade. Also shows a blind woman working swiftly to create a bristle scrubbing brush. Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Gungarri woman
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Linda Wordie
results.brief_description: Linda is a Gungarri woman, and she has breast cancer. With this diagnosis you see life differently, butterflies, the moon and big cups of tea that become part of life’s healing.
